titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Educational Main Street (EMS) records ARCH158
titlestmt.author: Sean Parke

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-06-15 11:46:33 -0400.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: The collection contains the publications, subject files, promotional and educational materials, as well as general office records of Educational Main Street (EMS), a tutoring program at the University of Hartford.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Educational Main Street (EMS) was a program started by Superintendent Hernan LaFontaine and University President Humphrey Tonkin in 1990. The program was part of the President's office until 1996 when it moved to the College of Education, Nursing, and Health Professions, where it stayed until it closed in 2015.
The program trained University students to tutor schoolchildren in the Hartford area during and after school. University students could earn course-credit for their participation.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection came to the archives in no particular order. Some materials were together in large binders or folders. The binders oftentimes revolved around the same project or report in which case they were kept together in their order. Folders which contained various materials (forms and promotional materials which appeared to be for distribution as a packet) had some items removed, but the removed items were photocopied or at least documented.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Educational Main Street (EMS) records consist of a wide variety of records that were brought to the archives after the program closed. The collection contains publications like their literacy magazine and various newsletters; files on various programs, both from EMS and from other educational organizations; instructional handbooks for students, tutors, and parents; evaluations and assesments of EMS; general office records; photographs of EMS events; and artifacts.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: EMS materials can also be found in the College of Education, Nursing, and Health Professions (ENHP) collection (ARCH055).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into eight series: I. Publications; II. Handbooks; III. Programs and Projects; IV. Reports, Summaries, and Evaluations; V. General Records and Office Documents; VI. Photographs; VII. Artifacts; VIII. Compact and Floppy Discs.

controlaccess.subject: Tutors and tutoring
controlaccess.corpname: University of Hartford. College of Education, Nursing, and Health Professions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the EMS Literacy Magazines (1992-2009), as well as various public relations material including brochures, leaflets, pamphlets, UNotes, clippings, and newsletters (Partners, 1991-2008; Tutor Talk, 1992-2008; Parents Newsletter, 2005-2007; Global Communications Academy, 2009 Apr).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by publication and then organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of handbooks that EMS distributed to tutors, students, and their parents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged by handbook title and then organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Programs and Projects series contains plans, outlines, promotional materials, participation records, and assesments of various educational programs, some of which were conducted by other organizations that were of interest to EMS staff.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged by program/project name and then organized chronologically.

did.unittitle: Series IV: Reports, Summaries, and Evaluations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of regular internal and external evaluations, as well as undated assessment forms/surveys and the Blue Hills Survey (2003). The largest portions of the series are the regular assessments by the University of Hartford, as well as the external assessments by the Center For Urban Research Education and Training, Inc. (CURET).

did.unittitle: Series V: General Records and Office Documents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of a wide array of materials including correspondence, financial records, student/volunteer records (private and confidential information redacted by the Archives), forms, event invitations/fliers, calendars, notes, and general information about EMS.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged by filename (created by archives) and then organized chronologically.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The photographs were in no obvious order when they arrived to the archives. During processing, groups of photographs that appeared to be together and of the same event were kept together to the best of the processor's ability and were left in the order that they were removed from boxes, since most of the photographs are unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Photographs series consists primarily of 4 x 6 inch prints, as well as larger prints (5x7s and 8x10s), polaroids, and negatives of EMS events. The majority of these photographs are unidentified. However, some photographs do have notes written on the back or were identified by notations on post-its or envelopes which have been photocopied or transferred to their protective sleeves. Digital copies of these photographs may also be available in Series VIII: Compact and Floppy Discs series.
The photographer (or photographers) of these photographs are unknown. However, according to their envelopes, many of the photographs were sent out by Virginia Pertillar to be developed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of certificates, plaques, folders with logos, a banner ("20 years of making a difference, 1990-2010"), a sign, and a framed depiction of Educational Main Street as a street with its participants shown as streets and buildings.

did.unittitle: Series VIII: Compact and Floppy Discs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of floppy discs and compact discs (CDs). Most of the discs contain photographs, many of which can be seen as prints in Series VII: Photographs. However, this series also contains general office documents, reports, and a portfolio. Some of these CDs contain a mix of photographs and documents.
